word_mean: 幻觉：无外界源的感觉，感到实际并不存在的物体的外界刺激

sentence.Network_en: Hallucination is common in patients who have suffered damage to the brain.
sentence.Network_cn: 脑部受损的病人常会产生幻觉。

sentence.Network_en: Perhaps the footprint was a hallucination.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 幻觉（hallucination）与错觉不同，它是在没有相应的外界客观事物直接作用下发生的不真实感知。幻觉具有与真实知觉类似的特点， …

list.abs: hallucination 幻觉hallucination experience 幻觉体验hallucination of perception 知觉性幻觉知觉性幻觉.
... . . .ory hallucination)指在没有嗅觉刺激时出现了嗅觉体验大多是一些难闻的令人不愉快的气味 ⑷味幻觉(gustatory hallucination)指病人尝到食物中有某种特殊的或奇怪的味道因而拒绝进食 ⑸幻触(tactile hallucination)患者感到皮肤或黏膜上有某种异常的感觉如虫爬感风吹.

...破碎的人形或令人惊恐的怪物猛兽。多见于感染，中毒所致的精神障碍。误食毒蕈可出现丰富幻觉。云南省居民食用一种小美牛肝蕈时，常出现形象比实物小的，小人国样幻视，。(3)幻嗅(olfactory hallucination)、较少见，病人可闻到各种特殊的气味，如异香，奇臭，血腥，烧焦气味等。见于颞叶癫痫与精神分裂症(图23-1)。(4)幻味(gustatory hallucination)、较少见，.
cenesthetic 普通感觉cenesthetic hallucination 机体统觉性幻觉cenesthopathy 体感幻觉

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Latin hallucinatio(n-), from the verb hallucinari (see hallucinate)

entry.tran: （因生病或吸毒所致的）幻觉（体验）
entry.def: A hallucination is the experience of seeing something that is not really there because you are ill or have taken a drug.

example.ex: The drug induces hallucinations at high doses...
example.tran: 大剂量地服用该药会致幻。

example.ex: Hallucination is common in patients who have suffered damage to the brain.
example.tran: 脑部受损的病人常会产生幻觉。

entry.tran: （因生病或吸毒所见到的）幻象
entry.def: A hallucination is something that is not real that someone sees because they are ill or have taken a drug.

example.ex: Perhaps the footprint was a hallucination.

means.word_mean: 1. illusory perception; a common symptom of severe mental disorder
2. a mistaken or unfounded opinion or idea;

sentences.sentence: "his dreams of vast wealth are a hallucination"

means.word_mean: 3. an object perceived during a hallucinatory episode;

sentences.sentence: "he refused to believe that the angel was a hallucination"

auth_sentence.content: Jim, Kathy and their conversation had been a hallucination.
auth_sentence.res_content: Jim, Kathy and their conversation had been a hallucination.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Jim, Kathy and their conversation had been a hallucination.

auth_sentence.content: Had her distracted mind produced an hallucination?
auth_sentence.res_content: Had her distracted mind produced an hallucination?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Had her distracted mind produced an hallucination?

auth_sentence.content: Was what I experienced "real" or just an hallucination?

means.word_mean: 幻觉(因患病或吸毒而产生)

sentences.en: For a moment I thought I was having hallucinations.
sentences.cn: 一时间我以为我产生了幻觉。

sentences.en: He had hallucinations after he took drugs.
sentences.cn: 他吸毒以后产生了幻觉。
